memberdef.name: CUDA_GUARD
memberdef.initializer: do { \ cudaError_t _st = (call); \ if (_st != cudaSuccess) { \ ie_cuda_set_err(cudaGetErrorString(_st)); \ return -(int)_st; \ } \ } while (0)

briefdescription.para: Guard macro for CUDA runtime calls inside launchers.

detaileddescription.para: On failure: records the CUDA error string and returns the negative error code.

briefdescription.para: Thread-local buffer holding the most recent CUDA error message.

detaileddescription.para: The C-ABI launchers store any CUDA error textual description here so callers can retrieve it via ie_cuda_last_error_string().

briefdescription.para: Store an error message into the thread-local buffer (truncates).

parameterdescription.para: NUL-terminated message to copy; if NULL, clears the buffer.

memberdef.argsstring: (const float *__restrict__ W, const float *__restrict__ x, float *__restrict__ y, int rows, int cols, int ldW, float alpha, float beta)
memberdef.name: k_gemv_rowwise_f32

briefdescription.para: Kernel: row-wise GEMV (computes y = alpha * W * x + beta * y).

detaileddescription.para: Mapping: one block per output row; threads perform a strided reduction along the K (column) dimension; partial sums are reduced in shared memory.

parameterdescription.para: Number of rows in W and elements in y.
Number of columns in W and elements in x.

memberdef.argsstring: (const float *__restrict__ W, const float *__restrict__ x, const float *__restrict__ bias, float *__restrict__ y, int rows, int cols, int ldW, float alpha, float beta, ie_act_kind_t act)
memberdef.name: k_gemv_bias_act_f32

detaileddescription.para: Computes y = act(alpha * W*x + bias + beta*y).

parameterdescription.para: Per-row bias of length rows (device, may be NULL).
Number of rows / elements in y.
Number of columns / elements in x.

memberdef.argsstring: (float *__restrict__ y, const float *__restrict__ x, int n)
memberdef.name: k_vec_tanh_f32

briefdescription.para: Kernel: elementwise tanh on a vector.

memberdef.argsstring: (float *__restrict__ Wp, const float *__restrict__ W, int rows, int cols, int ldW, int block_k)
memberdef.name: k_pack_w_blockedk_f32

briefdescription.para: Kernel: pack row-major W into Blocked-K layout (see header docs).
CUDA implementations of GEMV/activation/packing kernels + C-ABI launchers.

detaileddescription.para: This is the only TU that includes CUDA headers. The public header ie_kernels_cuda.h keeps the rest of the codebase CUDA-agnostic.

sect2.title: Kernel policy (baseline, safe defaults)

listitem.para: GEMV row-wise: one block per output row, 256 threads per block, strided K loop with shared-memory reduction.
Fused GEMV+bias+activation: same grid policy with a short epilogue.
Vector tanh: grid-stride loop with 256-thread blocks, large grid.
Packing (Blocked-K): 2D grid over (cols, rows) with 32x8 threads.

sect2.para: These settings favor portability and predictability. They are easy to tune per architecture once you profile on target GPUs.
